originalText.text: Flushing office has the worst service I ever experienced.   I had to wait more than 30 minutes until I see Dr. Kim.  After seeing Dr. Kim the desk person asked me to wait.  I thought I had to wait to get the prescription for eye glasses.  They never call me.  I asked her should I wait.  She simply said just wait.  After 1 hour even after Dr. Kim left the office, I asked her again what I was waiting for.  She said who asked you to wait.  I couldn't believe it.  I was the only one left, and they just ignored me.

originalText.text:
This review is only about John J Kim.
On the day I went to the eye clinic for my annual eye exam ( John J Kim was one of their ophthalmologists at that time )... After the O.T. finished vision tests. John J Kim came in the room. Even though I said hello, he didn't say a word. Quite rude! Bad attitude. Without any warning, he flipped my upper-eyelid upward abruptly, I was in pain and shock. Zero bedside manner. When he talked, finally, his tone was totally unacceptable! IMO, John J Kim is a mean and nasty person. Hope he'll have a taste of his own medicine soon... I subsequently contacted the eye care clinic where John J Kim was working for at that time, but found out that he's no longer working there. Now I realized that he is working somewhere else. So again, this review is only about John J Kim, the ophthalmologist.

originalText.text:
Both this office location and his Waters place office waiting time is 4-5 hours despite of making an appointment. I called the office the other day and the receptionist was very blunt and said you can go to the waters place location for 4 hrs wait time or the city for 3 hours time! are you kidding me? if this was a free service I get it but you are damn billing my insurance for it and if not your billing me!
The doctor is good but not worth to wait half a day to be seen for 5 minutes. Plenty of great eye doctors and surgeons out there! this is America and I wonder how the Department of Health allows this to go on, booking patients every 2 minutes? I would call it a butchers shop instead of "Clearview". my recommendation? get yourself another office!

originalText.text: I went to Queens location to get and waited 4 hours to get seen by doctor.  looks like its a trend.  on top of that they keep sending me bills which I already paid for.  I contacted above Manhattan office which deals with billing, Audrey picked up with nasty attitude and tone, did not even address my problem.  Just stated " billing is busy She'll call you back if there is a problem.  What a nasty employee.  Never going to any of Clearview eye surgery places Queens ,Bronx or Manhattan.

originalText.text: Dr. Kim is an amazing doctor. Brilliant, quick and precise. He is definitely worth whatever wait time there is. The inconvenience of a little wait time pales in comparison to the lasting convenience of restored sight. 6 Stars!
